text.p: EquiMed Inc on Thursday forecast 1997 earnings of $0.46 per share, and net income of $14 million on revenues of $137 million.

It said its Oncology business will produce about $58 million in revenues and generate an additional $15 million in revenues from new acquisitions. The division should grow at a rate of about 25 percent a year in 1997 and beyond, "fueled largely by anticipated acquisitions," EquiMed said.
The company said it will open three new Rejuve Image Enhancement Centers by the end of the 1997 first quarter and plans to open as many as 24 centers by the end of 1998.
For 1995, the latest year for which figures are available, EquiMed reported that its Colkitt Oncology Group had revenues of $58.8 million and income of $10.2 million before extraordinary items.
In the same year, its EquiVision unit had revenues of $41.3 million and income of $681,000 before extraordinary items.
